section.title: Description
section.b: This step executes a request to a particular URL.

pre.b: If the URL starts with a protocol (e.g. http://...) then the URL is treated is being fully qualified and invoked directly. Otherwise, the URL is treated as a relative suffix and the URL to invoke is determined from the settings specified with the element, including port, protocol and basepath.

The result of the request is internally stored and its contents can be verified with one or more <verify...> steps. If the saveresponse option in the element is enabled, the result (HTML source) will be written to a file for later viewing.
Note: If the URL contains an ampersand character (&), e.g. for parameter separation, it must be expressed using the XML element notion with "&".

attribute.name: description
attribute.description: The description of this test step.

attribute.name: url
attribute.description: A complete URL or the 'relative' part of an URL which will be appended to the 'static' parts created from the configuration information defined with the <config> step.

attribute.name: contentType
attribute.description: Sets the content-type HTTP header for POST and PUT requests

attribute.name: method
attribute.description: Sets the HTTP Method, i.e. whether the invoke is a GET, POST, PUT, etc.

attribute.name: contentFile
attribute.description: Filename to extract request contents from. Ignored for GET requests. Only one of content and contentFile should be set.

attribute.name: content
attribute.description: Form data in 'application/x-www-form-urlencoded' format, which will be sent in the body of a POST request. Ignored for GET requests. Only one of content and contentFile should be set.

attribute.name: soapAction
attribute.description: If the HTTP method is POST and is in fact a SOAP POST request, this allows the SOAP Action header to be set. Ignored for GETs.

attribute.name: username
attribute.description: A username that can be provided for pages that require basic authentication. Typically only needed on the first step of any accessing a secure site. Required if password is specified.

attribute.name: password
attribute.description: A password that can be provided for pages that require basic authentication. Required if username is specified.

attribute.name: save
attribute.description: A shorthand: save='prefixName' is the same as savePrefix='prefixName' saveResponse='true'.

attribute.name: savePrefix
attribute.description: A name prefix can be specified for making a permanent copy of received responses. A unique number and the file extension (depending on the MIME-Type) will be appended. The resultpath attribute of the <config> element is used for determining the location of the saved result.
attribute.required: no, default is the 'savePrefix' parameter as specified in <config>.

attribute.name: saveResponse
attribute.description: Whether to make a permanent copy of received responses. Overrides the default value set in the <config> element.

section.title: Inline Text

attribute.name: text
attribute.description: An alternative way to set the 'url' or the 'content' attribute. When the 'url' attribute is not specified the nested text is considered as the url value. Otherwise this is used to set the 'content' attribute for e.g. large content (properties get evaluated in this content).
